Posts.Content: petesmom wrote: My 44 year old sister in law was diagnosed with contralateral breast cancer recently.  I don't know much about her path report except that both cancers were found by mammogram and the new PEM. I would appreciate hearing from those women who have been through this.  She and my brother feel like they have been hit with a wrecking ball which is normal (I am a 2x survivor having been diagnosed the 1st time when I was not much older than my sister in law). She is currently undergoing treatment at Hopkins so she is at a great center.  Thanks ladies. Petesmom Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cancer in both breasts petesmom AnneW

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2008 10:10PM petesmom wrote: Thanks Beesie, With all of the new diagnostics, I think the use of highly sensitive tests like PEM will reduce the number of women (like me) who have to deal with a recurrence.  My brother and sister-in-law are just reeling with the news but they are looking at treatment options.  They should feel better once they set a course of treatment and get started.  I know I did.  Petesmom
Posts.Title: Cancer in both breasts petesmom AnneW
